titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pennsylvania Radiological Society Records, 1916-1984 AIS.1992.01
titlestmt.author: Gail Giroux. The collection was processed and revised by Andy Newman in June 2004.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:22:51 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection consists of the records of the Pennsylvania Radiological Society for the years 1916-1984. The Society is a professional medical organization established in Altoona, Pa., in 1916. In 1969 the Society became a chapter of the American College of Radiology. The collection contains the history, constitution and by-laws, correspondence, minutes, agendas, publications, and membership records of the Society.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Pennsylvania Radiological Society began as the Roentgen Ray Society of Central Pennsylvania organized in Altoona, Pa., in May 1916. The Society's founders were Doctors G. D. Bliss, W. A. Reily, and Harry W. Stewart. The Society was a social meeting place for doctors and students of radiology. The purpose of the Society was to discuss issues related to X-Ray diagnosis, X-Ray/or radium treatment, and medical advancements of the time.

The Society's membership rose steadily into the 1920s with the increase of professionals practicing radiology. Membership spread from central Pennsylvania to include Pittsburgh and Williamsport, Pa., In 1929 at the 14th annual Fall meeting the Society's name was changed to the Pennsylvania Radiological Society. In the 1930s the Society expanded its radiology concentration to include Nuclear Medicine.

In 1969 the Society was recognized as a chapter of the American College of Radiology. The Society's publication The Pennsylvania Journal of Radiology ran from 1933-1950 until its name was changed to The Bulletin of the Pennsylvania Radiological Society in 1951. The PA Radiological Society continues to function today as a chapter of the American College of Radiology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the records of the Pennsylvania Radiological Society for the years 1916-1984. Most of the records are in the form of correspondence from officials or committees of the Society. Series I contains records pertaining to the administrative function of the society which includes constitution and bylaws and Board of Director's minutes. Series II consists of the correspondence of the Society's founder W. A. Reily, other officials, and professional organizations. Series III consists of committee records that are in the form of correspondence. Series IV contains the membership records of the society. Series V contains the Society's publications and research on various topics which are arranged by subject. Additional notes about the collection are located at the series level.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These records were transferred from the Falk Medical Library, University of Pittsburgh in 1992.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Pennsylvania Radiological Society Records, AIS.1992.01, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Pennsylvania Radiological Society Records, AIS.1992.01, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was inventoried by Gail Giroux in 1992 and then processed and encoded by Andrew Newman in June 2004.

Revision and rearrangement for the encoded version of the finding aid provided by Andy Newman in June, 2004. Information about the collection title and the controlled access terms was extracted from the MARC record in the University of Pittsburgh catalog Voyager ID number: 1429360

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

controlaccess.subject: Health and medicine
Societies
Radiology -- Pennsylvania
controlaccess.corpname: Roentgen Ray Society of Central Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series I contains the administrative records of the Society. The records are organized alphabetically and then arranged chronologically. The majority of the records span 1960-1980.

did.unittitle: History of the PA Radiology Society
Outline of Radiology by Educational Committee
Pennsylvania College of Nuclear Medicine, Meeting Minutes
Statement Before Financial Management Seminar by John Larkin Thompson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series II contains correspondence from many of the Society's officials and corresponding organizations. The records are arranged alphabetically. The series contains the correspondence of W. A. Reilly, the founder of the Pennsylvania Roentgen Ray Society which predated the Pennsylvania Radiological Society.

did.unittitle: Councilors to American College of Radiology
Hospital of the University of PA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series III consists of committee records in the form of correspondence. The records document the committee's function in the Society and beyond. The records are arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: AD HOC Committees, Committee on Blue Shield Implementation
AD HOC Committees, Committee on Constitution and By-Laws

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series IV contains membership records of the Society. There are 106 member files which contain photos, professional degrees, and publications. The member records are arranged alphabetically by last name. Additional records consist of annual member lists and membership forms.

did.unittitle: List of Officers, Directors, and Councilors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series V contains the Society's publications and medical research files. This series contains the Society's newletters.

did.unittitle: American College of Radiology Quality Study

unittitle.title: The Bulletin of the Pennsylvania Radiological Society
